alert.note: Alert for Lower Plaquemines (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:55PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Plaquemines Parish through 700 PM CDT... At 555 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Pointe A La Hache, or near Port Sulphur, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Port Sulphur, Pointe A La Hache and Empire. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
